title: [Large-Scale] Ethical Practices in Online Language Education: Applied Philosophy-Based Microlearning and Text Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of fundamental educational ethics, online learning experience, basic grammar and vocabulary in language education, and foundational text analysis skills
context.additional_context: A process cultivating practical judgment by analyzing ethical dilemmas in smartphone-based language learning environments. Emphasizes customized instructional design considering learners' reading comprehension and expressive skills. Particularly aims to enhance communication abilities through writing proficiency and cultural context understanding in digital environments.

learning_goals: Identify three or more ethical conflict cases in online language learning environments (e.g., plagiarism, copyright infringement, cultural bias) and develop critical reading skills through text structure analysis

Apply Aristotleâ€™s concept of phronesis (practical wisdom) to make ethical decisions in daily language education contexts and demonstrate context-aware expression and culturally informed judgment during peer communication

Propose five ethical standards for learner-instructor relationships in digital language learning environments (e.g., fairness in feedback, cultural sensitivity, language use norms, appropriateness of vocabulary selection, grammar error correction methods) and apply them to real cases

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
